result.execSummary:
This case is being appealed. If the court makes a decision in a case that a party disagrees with, the party may have the right to seek review by a higher court to determine if the trial court's decision was correct. Appeals are most often made after a trial or final decision in a case, but an appeal can also occur before a final decision.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes:
$2,402.76 represents restitution plus $240.28 restitution surcharge.  Defendant to pay his share of restitution (1/3 of $2,402.76 plus $240.28 restitution surcharge) during the period of extended supervision.  Money to be dispursed to party who paid restitution in full.
Pursuant to Restitution Order (DOC-31) dated 08/22/2016, $600.69 represents this defendant's share of restitution (to be paid to co-defendant Michael R.).  There is no restitution surcharge.

Plus supervision fees.    
If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due. All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.    
$250 represents DNA surcharge.
Any assessment and counseling as required and follow through and complete all required treatment.

No contact with: Jonathan R., Zachary W., T.R.S., Marissa P., Dillan S. and Bateman Express.    
Not to possess or consume any alcohol.  
Not to possess or consume any illegal drugs.  
Not to go on any premises where primary purpose is the sale of alcohol.  
Not to possess any drug paraphernalia.  
Not to associate with anyone using illegal drugs or involved in illegal activities.

records.addlTxt: Motion Hearing - July 7, 2022
It is Ordered that the appellant's motions for release on bond pending appeal and review of the circuit court's decision to deny him release on bond pending appeal are denied.
Motion to Court of Appeals. Sent electronically
Letter from defendant filing motion to Court of Appeals

3:33 PM Defendant Cody M Boehm appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Roy La Barton Gay in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Court calls case and notes appearances
Court notes Mr. Boehm's request for $7500 recognizance bond; Statute requires defendant to post cash bond noting statute 969.09
Mr. Boehm responds and requests $1,000 cash bond
State notes position of defendants request for bond and states there is no case law supporting defendants position and success of appeal. The state objects to motion based on the success factor and inmates conduct record is reviewed on the record. 
Mr. Boehm makes statement re: bond request
Court reminds Mr. Boehm that issues with appeal to be heard by the appeals court
Court notes initial sentence was 10 years initial 5 years ES 
Court is to consider multiple factors in granting motion for bond while pending appeal; Court analyzes those factors
Factors in 809.31(3) 969.01(4) have been reviewed by court
Court denies Mr. Boehms motion for relief for bond to be issued pending appeal
From Defendant, RE; Financial Status - Sent for review
Motion hearing on July 7, 2022 at 03:30 pm.
for Release on Bond Pending Appeal - Filed by Defendant, Sent for review
